body:
Hey Summoners,

**I’m Irene (aka littlemisscheeky), and I’m the Social Media Manager at Riot OCE. I'm going to be hanging around for the next few hours answering anything you’d like to know about me and what I do :)**

Here’s a bit of background about myself… I’ve been into video games ever since I got my first Atari 5200. My fondest memory comes from playing the original Nintendo Game Boy where I was able to play 2-player Tetris by connecting my Game Boy with a friend’s via a cable. Back in the day that blew my mind! I’m a HUGE Street Fighter fan and my arcade stick collection is a testament to my “small” obsession. Before playing league, you’d normally find me playing a lot of first person shooters. 

I’ve always wanted to work in the gaming industry but I started my career as a graphic/web designer at an agency. I’ve been at Riot a little bit over 6 months now and this is my first venture into the gaming industry. Before this, I’d been in digital marketing for 9 years. I kept my passion for games alive by organising corporate gaming nights with other agencies and other gamers in the corporate world. 

My favourite champions are currently Morg, Susan, Ahri and Jinx. 

Outside of gaming, I love Taylor Swift, snowboarding, Nerf, as well as going to Ninjutsu and hip hop dancing classes. 

So that’s a little bit about me :) Feel free to ask me anything!

Hi 0j0j0, I'd describe my job as challenging, ever-changing, exciting and fun :)

What role are you interested in at Riot? That way I can better refine the "words of inspiration" for you ;)
I am interested in the esports team and thanks for replying :)

If you're interested in eSports, a good first step is to try and become an active member and even a leader of an eSports community. 

For any role, I try and think, "What would I want from e.g. an eSports manager?" "What qualities should they have and why?" "How do I rate myself currently against those qualities?" "What do I have to do to level up in those weaker areas?"

That should give you a good road map. You can also find someone that is already doing your dream role, reach out to them on LinkedIn etc. Ask them for tips. Find out how they formed their career to get to that position. Can you do the same or something similar? This approach might sound a bit out there, but I've done it a number of times. You may be surprised at how much people are willing to help, all you have to do is ask. 

I hope that helps!

What's your average day in the Riot OCE office like? How do you plan out your day?

I'm a gaming community manager that skips in and out of social media so I'm always keen to chat to other community peeps about their day :).

_Love, Snowy_

Hi Snowy!

My days are usually planned out at least 3 days in advance. I do this because I like to know what I'm doing ahead of time, plus it helps me be organised. Because social media doesn't sleep, a typical day for me consists of being on social media for much of it, whether it's planning out what to post, replying to msgs/comments and thinking of ideas to level up our social media e.g. integrating gamification into the OPL broadcast. But I am also involved in other areas such as Community and eSports, so that takes up my time throughout the week as well.

How do I plan my day/week? I generally split activities into 4 categories:
1. Important, Not urgent
2. Important, Urgent
3. Not important, urgent
4. Not important, not urgent

I don't do point 4. I try and spend majority of my time doing point 1. When point 2 comes up, I do it ASAP. And point 3, I ask more questions to see if it should be prioritised higher than what I already have for the day.

Oh cool, which community do you manage? :)

DERP I NEVER REPLIED haha,

I manage [Aspect of Gaming](http://aspectofgaming.co.nz/) in New Zealand and am the community manager at [Leaping Tiger](https://leaping-tiger.com/) which helps gamers all over the world connect :). LT is super young but we're already making so much of a difference, am so proud to be a part of it! I'm part of a good 30 or 40 other gaming communities and manager about 7 different social accounts for a number of them, it's hard to keep up with but exhilarating and keeps me on my toes ^^.

Very good management schedule you have there, I love it! My life is much the same, I live in the Chrome web browser danger zone known as 'tab city'. Right now I'm floating at 17 tabs on one screen and 8 tabs on the other >.< and whenever chrome looses them I die a little inside haha.

Wish you all the best <3
